references.paper_title: Deep convolutional networks are hierarchical kernel machines
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for understanding the relationship between deep convolutional networks and hierarchical kernel machines, which is relevant to the computational capabilities of ARDTs.
This book provides the background on computational complexity theory which is crucial for analyzing the computational power of ARDTs and comparing them to other models like Turing machines.
This paper introduces the random forest algorithm, a widely used ensemble method for decision trees that is relevant to the experimental methodology in the current paper.
This paper introduces stochastic gradient boosting, another ensemble method for decision trees which is relevant to the experimental methodology of the current paper.
This paper is foundational for decision tree learning algorithms and is directly relevant to the theoretical underpinnings of ARDTs and forms the basis of modern tree-based learning approaches.
